# How to get to the venue

The address is

Mathematical Institute</br>
Andrew Wiles Building</br>
Woodstock Rd</br>
Oxford OX2 6GG</br>

```{r}
#| echo: false

library(leaflet)
library(htmltools)
library(fontawesome)

colls <- read.csv("data/accomd.csv")
colls$color <- sapply(1:nrow(colls), \(i) if(i < 19) "blue" else "pink")
colls$pop <- sapply(1:nrow(colls), \(i) paste(a(href = colls$URL[i], colls$Name[i])))

icons <- awesomeIconList(blue = makeAwesomeIcon(
  text = fa("bed", fill = '#F54927')
), 
pink = makeAwesomeIcon(
  text = fa("bed", fill = '#FFAF80')
))



leaflet() %>%
  addTiles() %>%  
  addMarkers(lat=51.76077448023744, lng=-1.26274603165126, popup="EuroCIM Oxford Venue", 
  icon = makeIcon("eurocim-icon.gif")) |> 
  addAwesomeMarkers(lat= colls$Latitude, lng = colls$Longitude, 
  popup= colls$pop, 
  icon = icons[colls$color])
```


[Get directions on Google maps](https://maps.app.goo.gl/6b3fFBQsXXXTUtgN9)

The Oxford University Mathematics Institute provides detailed information about access to the venue here: <https://www.maths.ox.ac.uk/about-us/travel-maps>.
